channel.title: Mercenary Suggestion
channel.description:
A lot of people are complaining that it is against the rules to bus your first contract. I have a suggestion that would both fix this problem while simultaneously making the mercenary more fun to play.
# Simply let the Mercenary choose their first contract! If they haven't picked a contract by N2, they commit suicide.
This puts the burden of choosing a good contract on the Mercenary themselves, so they can't complain about 'randomly rolling the NK' and not wanting to protect them.

item.title: Mercenary Suggestion
item.dc:creator: Malkraz
item.description:
Solution to the Mercenary question: If the Mercenary’s contract dies and the game ends before the Mercenary is able to give out his second contract, allow him to win
Lorewise, he could just give the second contract to somebody after the game
This incentivizes the Mercenary to stick with his first contract for as long as possible, because he has the safety net of the second contract keeping him alive either way
By ignoring his first target or actively bussing them, he makes his chances worse even if the second contract potentially has a higher likelihood of surviving
This is a solution through game design rather than one through ruling that potentially contradicts a decision to increase your odds of winning
